step1.sentence: She logged into her account just in time to renew a subscription before it expired.

step2.story: Tom got a notification reminding him to renew a subscription to his favorite music streaming service. He hesitated for a moment, wondering if he used it enough to justify the cost, then decided it was worth it.

step3.story: Every year around this time, Maya sits down with her coffee and reviews all her monthly services. This morning she realized she needed to renew a subscription to the online magazine she had been reading for years. She pulled up the website, checked the new pricing, and felt relieved to see it hadn't changed much. After entering her payment details, she received a confirmation email within seconds. It felt good to know her access would continue uninterrupted for another year.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 구독(서비스 이용 계약)을 다시 새롭게 하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 스트리밍, 잡지, 소프트웨어 등 정기 결제 서비스의 이용 기간이 끝날 때 계속 사용하기 위해 갱신하는 상황에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'renew'는 라틴어 'renovare(다시 새롭게 하다)'에서 유래했으며, 'subscription'은 라틴어 'subscribere(아래에 서명하다)'에서 비롯되어 계약·서비스 가입을 의미하게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 만료 직전이나 만료 후에 다시 등록하는 뉘앙스를 담고 있으며, 새로 시작하는 'start a subscription'과 달리 기존 서비스를 이어간다는 느낌이 강하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I need to renew a subscription to the software before the trial ends.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 체험 기간이 끝나기 전에 소프트웨어 구독을 갱신해야 해.
